root.NOTE: This XML file should only be used for documentation purposes.

method.name: LoadImage
method.comment: loads the given image file to the xResizeAndCrop Customview

method.name: RotateImage
method.comment: rotates the original image only multiples of 90 are allowed

property.name: CroppedView
property.comment: sets the Panel / Pane view for the cropped image, write only the Panel / Pane view must be added in the main code and transmitted to the custom view as this property.

property.name: CroppedImage
property.comment: gets the cropped image as a B4XBitmap, read only

property.name: Left
property.comment: sets or gets the Left property

property.name: Top
property.comment: sets or gets the Top property

property.name: Width
property.comment: sets or gets the Width property

property.name: Height
property.comment: sets or gets the Height property

property.name: Visible
property.comment: sets or gets the Visible property

property.name: MinCroppedWidth
property.comment: sets or gets the MinWidth property value in pixels, no dip value if WHRatio <> "None", the min cropped height is set acording to the width / height ratio

property.name: MinCroppedHeight
property.comment: sets or gets the MinHeight property value in pixels, no dip value valid only if WidthHeightRatio is different from "None" if WidthHeightRatio = "None" the min cropped height is set acording to the width / height ratio

property.name: HandleColor
property.comment: sets or gets the HandleColor property value must a xui color Example code: xResizeAndCrop1.HandleColor = xui.Color_RGB(255, 215, 0)

property.name: WidthHeightRatio
property.comment: sets or gets the WidthHeightRatio property possible values: None Square 1.5 4/3 16/9 Custom None = any width and height Square = True means that the resized image is always square 3/2 = ratio 1.5 2/3 = ratio 0.66667 4/3 = ratio 4/3 3/4 = ration 3/4 16/9 = ratio 16/9 9/16 = ratio 9/16 Custom = user defined ratio set in the WidthHeightRatioValue property

property.name: WidthHeightRatioValue
property.comment: sets or gets the WidthHeightRatioValue property only active if the WidthHeightRatio property is set to "None"
